redundancy and availability that is desired of a database whenever you do a
read or write amazon Aurora performs a quorum so for a read it needs a response
from at least three storage nodes and for rice it needs a response from at

terms of storage the Aurora storage grows naturally with as you consume the
storage and it can grow all the way up to 64 terabytes and if you have read

the database instant storage for RDS is available in three types we have

provisioned I ops is an SSD back storage option designed to deliver fast

desirable feature of or requested of a database is high availability ODS

quick recap AWS infrastructure consists of regions and availability zones

choose re yes you can deploy your database in a multi easy fashion
allowing you to fail over to a standby in case you have a planned for an
unplanned outage so the changes that are made to your primary database are

actually taking the changing the dns endpoint for your primary DF primary

your database without having to intervene or do anything in the case of

there are a variety of reasons why you want to choose Reed replicas maybe you

data warehousing scenario where you want to direct all your reporting queries to

so let's talk a little bit about backups in an audience automated backups are
enabled by default and when these automated backups are turned on for your
database instance RDS automatically performs a full daily snapshot of your
data during a preferred window that you define and captures the transaction logs
as they are made to your primary database when you initiate a point-in-time recovery transaction logs
are applied to the most appropriate daily backup in order to restore your database to the specific time you
requested these backups can be retained to a period of 35 days although this is
configurable but the maximum is is 35 days in addition to automated backups
you may want to take manual snapshots and manual snapshots are user initiated
and they enable you to backup your database instance in a known state as frequently as you wish and then when you
want to restore to that specific known state it is simply a matter of going to
the console and launching a database from that snapshot unlike the automated
backups manual snapshots are persisted until you explicitly delete them and for
durability they are stored in amazon s3
